News.title: Global Paints and Coatings Market Analysis and Outlook 2024-2032
News.summary: The global paints and coatings market was valued at $177.4 billion in 2023 and is forecasted to reach $269 billion by 2032, growing at a CAGR of 4.7% from 2023 to 2032. Key market drivers include the expansion of the construction and automotive industries, technological advancements in coating formulations, and stricter environmental regulations promoting eco-friendly products like water-based and low-VOC coatings. Waterborne coatings represent the largest product segment due to their lower environmental impact. By material, acrylics hold the largest market share, favored for their durability and color retention. The architectural and decorative sector is the largest application segment, fueled by global construction and urbanization. Geographically, the Asia Pacific region dominates the market, driven by rapid industrialization and a growing construction sector in countries like China and India. Major companies are focusing on R&D for sustainable products and expanding their global presence through strategic acquisitions.

News.title: Transparency Market Research Publishes Report on Paint and Coatings Market
News.summary: According to a report by Transparency Market Research Inc., the global paints and coatings market is projected to expand at a CAGR of 5.2% between 2022 and 2031, reaching an estimated value of US$ 369.85 billion by the end of the forecast period. [1] Key growth drivers include the increasing demand for eco-friendly, low-VOC formulations and the rapid development of smart coatings and nanotechnology. [1] The building and construction sector represents the leading end-use segment, propelled by global infrastructure projects. [1] Water-based technology is the dominant formulation due to its environmental benefits, while polyurethane resins lead the market because of their versatility and durability. [1] Market trends also show rising demand for customized architectural and automotive coatings and specialized anti-microbial coatings for hygiene-conscious sectors. [1] Geographically, North America is a mature market led by companies like Sherwin-Williams and PPG, Europe focuses on sustainability with leaders like AkzoNobel and BASF, and the Asia Pacific region is experiencing significant growth driven by urbanization, with key players including Asian Paints and Nippon Paint. [1] The competitive landscape is characterized by intense competition, driving innovation in sustainable and digital coating technologies. [1]

News.title: The Role of AI and Data in the Future of the Coatings Industry
News.summary: The article discusses the significant impact of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and data analytics on the coatings industry. While there is a lot of hype surrounding AI, the focus should be on practical applications and measurable outcomes in areas like Research & Development, production, and quality control. The author suggests that instead of being overwhelmed by the promises of AI, industry decision-makers should concentrate on implementing smart factory concepts. This will lead to more efficient processes, better product quality, and a stronger competitive advantage. The article emphasizes a shift from discussing AI's potential to actively integrating it into manufacturing for tangible benefits.

News.title: Micro Powders Launches New PFAS-Free Additive for Powder Coatings
News.summary: Micro Powders has introduced a new texture additive for powder coatings called MicroTex® 950. This product is specifically designed to replace polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE), a type of PFAS, in powder coating formulations. The launch of this additive is a direct response to the increasing demand for PFAS-free materials in the coatings industry, driven by regulatory pressures and environmental concerns. MicroTex® 950 aims to provide a comparable or superior texture effect to PTFE-based additives, without the associated environmental and health risks. This development is a significant step towards more sustainable powder coating technologies.

News.title: New Low-Emission Iron Oxide Pigments for Sustainable Coatings
News.summary: LANXESS is contributing to the development of low-emission coatings with its new range of iron oxide yellow pigments. These pigments are designed to significantly reduce the carbon footprint of coating formulations. The innovation from raw material suppliers like LANXESS is crucial for the industry's move towards greater sustainability. By providing components that have a lower environmental impact, they enable formulators to create more eco-friendly end-products. This is particularly important as the coatings industry faces growing pressure to adopt sustainable practices and reduce its overall carbon emissions, making these new pigments a key enabler of this transition.

News.title: Masco Corp. Reports $3.125 Billion in 2023 Coatings Sales
News.summary: Masco Corp. reported net sales of $3.125 billion for its paints and coatings segment in 2023, a decrease from $3.428 billion in 2021. The company's architectural coatings, including paints, primers, stains, and waterproofing products, are primarily sold in the U.S. and Canada through do-it-yourself channels. Key brands include Behr and Kilz, with The Home Depot being the largest customer via The Behr Process Corporation. In his 2023 shareholder letter, CEO Keith Allman highlighted Behr's strong DIY brand leadership, noting the expansion of its premium BEHR DYNASTY exterior paint line. The company also saw significant growth in its professional (Pro) paint business, achieving over 60% growth from 2021 to 2023, and plans to continue investing in this segment with partner The Home Depot.

News.title: Behr Unveils 'Tugboat' as 2024 Exterior Stain Color of the Year
News.summary: Behr Paint Company named 'Tugboat,' a versatile blend of brown and gray tones, as its 2024 Exterior Stain Color of the Year. The color is designed to enhance the natural beauty of wood grain while providing durable protection for exterior surfaces. Erika Woelfel, Behr's vice president of color and creative services, described the color as providing a new perspective on exterior wood stains with a timeless, organic beauty. This announcement is part of a larger initiative to address consumer uncertainty in color selection. The 'Tugboat' stain headlines Behr's first-ever 'Curb Appeal Collection,' a curated palette of 30 exterior paints, stains, and spray paints. This collection was developed in response to a Behr study finding that 55% of homeowners find color selection to be the biggest hurdle in home exterior projects.

News.title: Behr Announces First-Ever Commercial Color Forecast for 2025
News.summary: Behr Paint Company introduced its first-ever Commercial Color Forecast for 2025, which debuted at the NeoCon conference in Chicago. Titled 'No Clear Boundaries,' the forecast was developed with input from design professionals at leading U.S. architectural firms. It features five distinct color themes intended for use across various residential and commercial sectors, including hospitality, workplace, and healthcare. The palettes are designed to be versatile, ranging from neutral to bold tones. The five themes are: 'Limitless Whites' (barely-there warm whites), 'Bleisure' (mid-tones inspired by nature), 'Renew-trals' (a new take on healing neutrals), 'Grand-Luxe' (deep hues for sophistication), and 'AI-sthetic' (soft pastels with bright accents for creativity).

News.title: 2025 CEO Forum: Coatings Industry Leaders on Market Outlook
News.summary: In the 2025 CEO Forum, leaders from top global coatings companies including AkzoNobel, BASF, Hempel, and Berger Paints, discussed the industry's performance and future outlook. The market in 2024 was mixed; AkzoNobel saw solid organic growth despite varied regional performance, while BASF maintained its previous year's level by compensating for automotive sector declines with growth in surface technology. Companies like Benjamin Moore noted that while the market was better than 2023, factors like mortgage rates and inflation created choppy demand. Several CEOs, including those from Berger Paints and Hempel, highlighted increased competition and macroeconomic instability. Looking ahead, most do not anticipate a significant market rebound in 2025 but see growth opportunities in specific areas. Key growth drivers identified include marine and protective coatings, powder coatings, construction chemicals, and sustainable/water-based technologies. R&D efforts are heavily focused on sustainability, with companies developing eco-friendly solutions like low-bake powder coatings (AkzoNobel), coatings for green energy (Berger Paints), and products with bio-based materials (Vitex). Strategies for 2025 center on cost efficiency, operational improvements, innovation in sustainable products, and strategic portfolio management to navigate ongoing economic uncertainties.

News.title: Global Paints and Coatings Market Analysis and Outlook 2024-2032
News.summary: The global paints and coatings market reached a value of $177.4 billion in 2023 and is forecast to grow to $269 billion by 2032, reflecting a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 4.7% from 2023 to 2032. This market growth is primarily driven by the expansion of the construction and automotive sectors, increasing environmental awareness, and stringent regulations concerning Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs). Technological innovations, including the development of nanocoatings, green coatings, and smart coatings, are also significant drivers. The report segments the market by product, material, application, and region. Waterborne coatings are the largest product segment, favored for their low VOC content. Acrylics dominate the material segment due to their durability and versatility. The architectural and decorative sector is the largest application segment, while the Asia Pacific region leads the market geographically, fueled by rapid industrialization and urbanization in countries like China and India.

News.title: Michelin Announces Construction of an Industrial Demonstrator
News.summary: On June 5, 2025, Michelin announced plans to construct a new industrial demonstrator. Further details regarding the project's relevance to the coatings industry, its location, scale, or technological focus were not available in the provided source.

News.title: DELTA Coatings Breaks Ground on New Headquarters
News.summary: DELTA Coatings, a company in the coatings sector, broke ground on a new headquarters facility on June 5, 2025. The provided text did not include specifics on the location, size, or capabilities of the new headquarters.

News.title: ACA Promotes Inaugural World Paint and Coatings Week
News.summary: The American Coatings Association began celebrating the first-ever World Paint and Coatings Week on March 17, 2025. This event is designed to raise the profile and recognize the importance of the paint and coatings industry globally.

Patents.title: New Patent for Ergonomic Paint Can Handles to Reduce Spills
Patents.summary: A recent patent has been highlighted that focuses on a seemingly small innovation with a potentially large impact: an ergonomic grip for paint can handles. This innovation aims to address the common problem of paint spills, which leads to product loss, safety hazards, and operational inefficiencies, especially in retail environments. The improved handle design is intended to provide a more secure and comfortable grip, thereby reducing the likelihood of accidental drops and spills during handling and transport. This development is relevant to the coatings industry as it offers a practical solution to a persistent issue, improving safety and reducing waste throughout the supply chain.

Conference.title: ACA Industry Awards Dinner Wrap Up 2024
Conference.summary: The American Coatings Association (ACA) held its annual Industry Awards Dinner on April 29, 2024, in Indianapolis to recognize outstanding contributions from industry leaders. Several awards were presented. The Industry Statesman Award, for career-long service, was given to six retired executives: Jeff Filley (Behr Paint), Laurel Jamison (Rudd Company), Doug Mattscheck (ICP Group), Michael McGarry (PPG), John Morikis (Sherwin-Williams), and Thierry Vanlancker (AkzoNobel). The Industry Excellence Award for technical contributions was presented to Kurt Wood, a retired scientist from Arkema, Inc., for his significant work in developing waterborne PVDF emulsion platforms and service-life prediction models, which resulted in seven U.S. patents. Adriana Hemann of The Sherwin-Williams Company received the Industry Achievement Award for her leadership on a STEM recruitment video project aimed at attracting new talent to the coatings sector. Lastly, the Distinguished Partner Award was given to Juergen Nowak of Vincentz Network for his crucial role in establishing the American Coatings Show and Conference.

Conference.title: Introduction to Paints and Coatings
Conference.summary: This course provides an overview of the paint and coatings industry, covering core fundamentals of performance and key raw materials, including their chemistry, mechanisms, and application. It is designed for R&D and business personnel, particularly newcomers, in all sectors of the industry such as architectural paints and industrial coatings. The curriculum includes topics like the purpose of coatings, an industry overview with major players, the production process, chemistry of polymers, pigments, and additives, as well as application and testing methods. The course is suitable for a wide range of professionals, from chemists to marketing and sales staff.

Conference.title: How to Formulate New Products
Conference.summary: Aimed at formulators and lab managers, this course details a systematic process for developing new coatings, adhesives, and similar products. The presentation covers the entire product development lifecycle, from initial concept to market success. Key topics include formulation from scratch, the use of formulation software, intellectual property considerations, formulating to cost targets, and effective testing techniques with customers. The course is designed to provide practical tips for new formulators and advanced advice for experienced professionals, highlighting common pitfalls to avoid to ensure successful product launches. The goal is to create products that lead to high customer satisfaction and repeat business.

Conference.title: Formulating for Architectural Coatings
Conference.summary: This course focuses on the raw materials used in architectural coatings, including resins/binders, additives, solvents, and pigments. It will also cover the required properties for these coatings and the corresponding testing methods. A significant portion of the course is dedicated to formulating strategies for optimizing coating rheology and reducing Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs). The content is designed to provide a comprehensive understanding of how to formulate modern, compliant, and effective architectural coatings by carefully selecting and combining the four main groups of raw materials.

Conference.title: Pigment Dispersion
Conference.summary: This course addresses the challenge of achieving stable pigment dispersions in paints and coatings. It covers the theory and practice of pigment dispersion, including the chemistry of wetting and dispersing agents, stabilization mechanisms like the electric double layer and DLVO theory, and the concept of depletion flocculation. Participants will learn about different types of dispersants, how to determine optimal concentrations, and the types of grinding equipment used. The course is aimed at formulating chemists but is also beneficial for personnel in marketing, sales, production, and customer service, providing a better understanding of how these agents contribute to the quality of finished products.

Conference.title: Waterborne Polymers and Film Formation
Conference.summary: Reflecting the industry trend towards sustainable solutions, this course covers waterborne polymers. It starts with a review of common monomers and the emulsion polymerization process. A major focus is on the mechanism of film formation, exploring factors that influence the glass transition temperature (Tg) and minimum film formation temperature (MFFT), such as monomer composition, particle size, coalescing agents, and hydroplasticization. The course aims to provide a foundational understanding of waterborne polymer technology, enabling participants to develop high-performance, environmentally friendly coatings that meet current market demands and regulatory standards. It is relevant for chemists, as well as sales, marketing, and production professionals.

A major focus is on the mechanism of film formation, exploring factors that influence the glass transition temperature (Tg) and minimum film formation temperature (MFFT), such as monomer composition, particle size, coalescing agents, and hydroplasticization. Conference.title: Advanced Powder Coatings Formulation
Conference.summary: This advanced course, titled 'Keeping it Cool: The Art and Science of Formulating Low-Temperature-Cure Powder Coatings,' concentrates on formulating powder coatings for heat-sensitive substrates. It covers the selection of appropriate resins, curing agents, and additives for low-temperature applications. The curriculum compares thermal cure versus radiation cure methods and discusses how to formulate for specific end-use performance requirements. While a basic overview of powder coatings is provided, the course is intended for participants who already possess a fundamental understanding of powder coating technology and its common resin systems.

Conference.title: Coatings Trends & Technologies Summit 2025
Conference.summary: The Coatings Trends & Technologies (CTT) Summit is scheduled for September 3, 2025. This annual conference serves as a key event for formulators and manufacturers in both liquid and powder coatings sectors. The summit is designed to facilitate discussions on the latest innovations in coatings technology. The event's agenda includes high-quality technical presentations, an exhibit hall showcasing new products and services, and various networking opportunities. This year, the summit is also offering four short courses for a more intensive and interactive learning experience. The CTT Summit is a significant event for the coatings industry, fostering collaboration and the exchange of new ideas.

Conference.title: ACA's 2025 CoatingsTech Conference
Conference.summary: The American Coatings Association (ACA) will host the 2025 CoatingsTech Conference in Pittsburgh, PA, from April 28-30, 2025. The conference theme is “Coatings and Technologies for a Resilient Future,” focusing on the latest science and technology developments in the coatings industry. The event is designed for all levels of coatings professionals to learn about technology-forcing factors and sustainable solutions for future market challenges. The keynote address, “Future-proofing Buildings: Pushing the Envelope Toward a More Resilient Future,” will be delivered by Andrea Wagner Watts, building science education manager at GAF. Additionally, Dr. Lipiin Sung of the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) will deliver the Mattiello Memorial Lecture, titled “Measurement Science for Coatings: from Color Appearance to Long-Term Durability Assessment.” The conference provides a key opportunity for industry experts to share knowledge on advancements in coatings technology.

Conference.title: ACA Announces Call for Papers: 2025 CoatingsTech Conference
Conference.summary: The American Coatings Association (ACA) has announced a call for papers for its upcoming 2025 CoatingsTech Conference, scheduled for April 28-30, 2025, at the Omni William Penn in Pittsburgh, PA. The theme for the biennial event is “Coatings and Technologies for a Resilient Future.” The association is accepting abstract submissions through October 15, 2024. The conference serves as a major forum for industry experts, including coatings manufacturers, raw material suppliers, academics, and government representatives, to present and discuss new research, developments, and industry trends. The technical program will feature a multi-track forum, with one full day dedicated to Service Life Protection. A wide range of paper and poster topics are being sought, including advances in architectural coatings, corrosion control, protective coatings, waterborne and radiation-cured coatings, nanotechnology, bio-based materials, and responses to environmental regulations concerning substances like PFAS and Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs).

Conference.title: A New Multi-Functional Silicone Emulsion for Durable Exterior Architectural Coatings
Conference.summary: This on-demand webinar focuses on a new functional silicone additive designed to enhance the long-term performance of exterior architectural coatings. The presentation will detail how this silicone emulsion improves durability without causing common issues like incompatibility, surface blooming, or poor dirt pickup that are often associated with traditional silicone polymer additives. The technology aims to provide a more robust and reliable solution for protecting and maintaining the appearance of exterior surfaces.

Conference.title: Revolutionizing Paints & Coatings: AI-Driven Innovations for Smarter Formulations
Conference.summary: This webinar explores the application of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the paints and coatings industry to create smarter formulations. It addresses key industry challenges such as balancing complex performance criteria, meeting regulatory constraints, and reducing the experimental workload in product development. The session will demonstrate how leveraging existing data with AI can optimize resource allocation, lower costs, and ensure compliance, leading to more efficient and innovative coating solutions.

Conference.title: Revolutionize Matte Coatings with Multifunctional Additives
Conference.summary: This presentation discusses the market drivers pushing formulators toward next-generation matting agents for coatings. It will delve into the latest multifunctional additive technologies designed to create high-performance matte finishes. The webinar aims to provide insights into how these advanced additives can improve not only the aesthetic qualities of matte coatings but also their functional properties, addressing the increasing demand for sophisticated, low-gloss surfaces in various applications.

Conference.title: Fibrillated Cellulose Boosts Performance of Elastomeric Roof Coatings
Conference.summary: This webinar focuses on the use of Valida fibrillated cellulose as a performance-enhancing additive in elastomeric roof coatings. The presentation will cover how this material improves the mechanical, surface, and rheological properties of the coatings. Key benefits to be discussed include enhanced durability, weather resistance, and application characteristics, offering a sustainable solution to improve the longevity and effectiveness of roofing systems.

Conference.title: Future-Proofing Formulations with TEGO® Foamex 16 for Decorative Coatings
Conference.summary: This webinar introduces TEGO® Foamex 16, a defoamer designed to enhance the performance and sustainability of decorative coatings. The session will explain the various advantages of this additive, demonstrating how it helps formulators create more robust and environmentally friendly products. The focus is on 'future-proofing' formulations against evolving regulatory requirements and consumer expectations for both performance and sustainability in the decorative market.

Conference.title: Transforming the Future of Colorant Tinting Systems
Conference.summary: This webinar introduces Vibrantz's Pearls™ technology, described as the industry's first volumetrically dosed tinting system using solid colorants for architectural and industrial paints. The presentation will cover how this sustainable and performance-enhancing technology works, its benefits over traditional liquid colorant systems, and its impact on the future of paint tinting, offering a novel approach to color formulation and application.

Conference.title: A Revolution in Color Management: Prediction of Color Stability
Conference.summary: This webinar, streamed from the Coatings Trends & Technologies (CTT) summit, addresses the critical issue of color stability in coatings. It explains how long-term exposure to sunlight can degrade fluorescent ingredients, causing fading and affecting a product's appearance. The presentation will focus on new methods for predicting color stability, a key factor in purchasing decisions, helping to ensure long-term color harmony and product quality in the coatings industry.

Conference.title: Comprehensive Stabilizer Systems for Water-Based Coatings
Conference.summary: This presentation, streamed from the CTT summit, details a new emulsification technology developed to make traditional light stabilizers dispersible in water. The webinar discusses optimized, synergistic blends of water-based UVA/HALS (Hindered Amine Light Stabilizers) designed to meet various performance requirements for different waterborne coating formulations. The innovation aims to enhance the durability and weather resistance of eco-friendly water-based systems.

Conference.title: Deploying AI and DOE in Real-Time at the Bench
Conference.summary: This webinar, also streamed from the CTT summit, discusses the practical application of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and AI-driven Design of Experiments (DOE) by chemists and materials scientists. The presentation will show how these tools are now being used in real-time at the laboratory bench, leading to a significant increase in productivity and innovation in the development of new materials, including coatings. It represents a major leap forward from traditional R&D methodologies.

Conference.title: David Fairhurst Receives 2025 CoatingsTech Best Paper Award
Conference.summary: David Fairhurst was announced as the recipient of the American Coatings Association's (ACA) 2025 CoatingsTech Best Paper Award on April 29, 2025. This award recognizes significant contributions to coatings technology presented at the CoatingsTech Conference.

Conference.title: Dr. Lipiin Sung Chosen for Mattiello Lecture at 2025 Conference
Conference.summary: On February 27, 2025, it was announced that Dr. Lipiin Sung will deliver the Mattiello Memorial Lecture at the American Coatings Association's 2025 CoatingsTech Conference. This prestigious lectureship is a highlight of the conference, honoring an individual who has made outstanding contributions to the field of coatings science and technology.

Conference.title: ACA Announces Webinar on TSCA Reform Status
Conference.summary: The American Coatings Association will host a member-exclusive webinar on July 17, 2025, focusing on the current status of TSCA (Toxic Substances Control Act) reform. This event will provide an update on legislative and regulatory changes affecting the chemical and coatings industries.

Legalnews.title: PFAS-Free Antistatic Coatings as Alternatives to Banned Substances
Legalnews.summary: This article explores the performance of antimony-doped tin oxide (ATO)-based antistatic coatings as a viable alternative to per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS), which are facing increasing regulatory bans. The study compares ATO with common alternatives like PEDOT and fluorinated anion-based additives. The findings indicate that ATO-based coatings offer superior stability and protection, particularly in pressure-sensitive adhesives (PSAs) used for LCD polarizers, where they effectively prevent static discharge. This is highly relevant for the coatings industry as it provides a potential solution to the widespread issue of replacing PFAS in various applications, ensuring compliance with new regulations while maintaining or even improving product performance.

Legalnews.title: ACA's Leadership on the NSF/ANSI 498 Architectural Coatings Standard
Legalnews.summary: The American Coatings Association (ACA), in partnership with NSF International, has led the development of the NSF/ANSI 498 Sustainability Program for Architectural Coatings. This initiative aims to establish a sustainability framework to help coatings manufacturers in green building certifications, provide the industry with influence in the standard's development, and clarify the sustainable attributes of architectural coatings. After a successful balloting process in May 2022 and subsequent amendments approved in October 2022, the program's publication was put on hold for further review. ACA formed a task force, which compiled over ten pages of proposed amendments by early 2024. A key concern is the potential conflict with the anticipated LEED Version 5, leading ACA to request a delay in NSF 498's publication for a detailed analysis. A major point of discussion within the program's Joint Committee is whether to narrow its focus to a product standard by removing social responsibility chapters or to maintain its broader sustainability scope. The program's status was pending further review and action as of early 2024.

Legalnews.title: SCAQMD Sets Public Hearing for Solvent Cleaning Rule Amendments
Legalnews.summary: A public hearing was announced by the South Coast Air Quality Management District (SCAQMD) to discuss proposed amendments to the Solvent Cleaning Operations Rule. The hearing was scheduled for June 6, 2025. This regulatory development is significant for coatings manufacturers and users who utilize solvent-based cleaning processes in the region.

Legalnews.title: ACA Issues Statement on Tariffs for Canada, Mexico, and China
Legalnews.summary: The American Coatings Association released a statement on March 4, 2025, addressing tariffs imposed on Canada, Mexico, and China. The statement's specific position, the products affected, and the potential impact on the coatings supply chain were not detailed in the source.

Legalnews.title: EPA Publishes List of Companies for TSCA Risk Evaluation Fees
Legalnews.summary: On February 3, 2025, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) published a preliminary list of companies that will be subject to fees for Toxic Substances Control Act (TSCA) risk evaluations. This action directly impacts chemical manufacturers and importers, including those within the paint and coatings industry, by assigning financial responsibility for the chemical risk assessment process.

Legalnews.title: Delayed EU REACH Revision Draft Expected After Mid-2024 Elections
Legalnews.summary: The European Union's ambitious "Green Deal" initiative, which aims to significantly revise REACH and CLP regulations, is behind schedule. Originally anticipated by the end of 2022, a draft of the new regulatory text has been pushed back multiple times. It is now expected to be published after the European elections in mid-2024. [1] This delay affects key changes for the coatings industry, including new registration requirements for polymers. The "Green Deal" also focuses on addressing microplastic pollution, sustainable product design, and strengthening the enforcement of environmental crime regulations related to REACH, BPR, and RoHS. [1] The final text will have a major impact on chemical classifications and registrations within the EU. [1]

Legalnews.title: UK to Diverge from EU REACH, New Details Expected in Early 2024
Legalnews.summary: The United Kingdom is set to diverge from the European Union's REACH model for chemical registration. While UK authorities previously delayed their registration scheme by three years, recent developments indicate a strategic shift from a hazard-data-driven system to a use- and exposure-driven registration effort. [1] This change could result in significant cost savings for the industry. Further details and information on what the final scheme will look like are anticipated to be published in early 2024. This move marks a significant departure from the EU model and will create a separate regulatory landscape for chemicals, including those used in coatings, for the UK market. [1]

Legalnews.title: New EU Hazard Classifications Mandated for Substances by May 2025
Legalnews.summary: The European Union has introduced new hazard classifications under the CLP regulation, specifically targeting endocrine disruptors (EDs) and other persistent, mobile, and toxic substances. According to the timeline provided by the European Chemical Agency (ECHA), these new classification and labeling requirements will become mandatory for new substances placed on the EU market starting from May 1, 2025. [1] The new rules also expand testing protocols to smaller import volumes (1-10 MT and 10-100 MT), which is expected to impact the economic viability of certain low-volume specialty chemicals used in the coatings industry. The deadline for existing substances already on the market is November 1, 2026. [1]

Legalnews.title: EU Biocidal Active Substance Review Extended Beyond 2024 Deadline
Legalnews.summary: The European Biocidal Products Regulation's (BPR) active substance review program, originally scheduled for completion in 2024, will be extended. [1] European authorities have determined they cannot assess the remaining active substances within the original timeframe. This delay is significant for the coatings industry, as this program determines the final list of permitted active biocides. [1] Once the list is finalized, introducing new biocide "actives" will become a costly and lengthy process, potentially stifling innovation. The extension means the current evaluation phase will continue beyond 2024, delaying the establishment of the final approved list and impacting market access for biocidal products. [1]
